channel.title: Help me choose a distro
channel.description:
*buntu is out of the question. It sucks, is buggy, and no WPA support.
I need WPA support for my wireless. I would like a user friendly, GUI and less terminal based(probably not like arch), fast, desktop/multimedia distro. It would be nice to have support and lots of apps.
I narrowed it down between Fedora, Freespire, and OpenSuSe. But please if you have a better one, tell me.
Also, how easy is it to remove linux and restore your harddrive to normal (remove the partitions)?
Also no KDE

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:193581”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=257711.msg2142918#msg2142918 date=1206764734]
I set it up in 8.04 and it worked. Next time I logged in, it didn’t work so I clicked “unlock” to change the settings and the button wouldn’t work. Maybe I’ll wait till the stable release.
[/quote]

8.04 is of course buggy since it is alpha or beta still. Use the current release, 7.10

http://www.kubuntu.com/download.php#latest[/quote]
Gah, to get WPA with kubuntu, I need internet to set it up. But my internet is wireless and it would be hard to run a wire.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @Vengeance Vengeance
item.description:
@Vengeance wrote:

Since you dont want KDE (What I have, and I dont regret it)

I’ve heard some people enjoy Debian and Red Hat.

Haven’t tried either.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

chrisn2323:

I set it up in 8.04 and it worked. Next time I logged in, it didn’t work so I clicked “unlock” to change the settings and the button wouldn’t work. Maybe I’ll wait till the stable release.

8.04 is of course buggy since it is alpha or beta still. Use the current release, 7.10

http://www.kubuntu.com/download.php#latest

Read full topic

don’t mock *buntu!

not every application, there is Amarok, Ark and Dolphin which don’t have the K

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

I clicked network settings and it only had WEP.

OpenSuSe has gnome too.

I gues KDE is fine, unless it has that really boxy look and every application has a K added to the front of the name.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Bullshit man, *buntu has had WPA since at least 6.06
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WPAHowTo
But if you really don’t like it, I’d go with OpenSuSe, however, that’s KDE by default as far as I know. To be perfectly honest, the greatest power of Linux is in the terminal, and you’re going to have to get used to it if you want to be a serious linux user.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

  1. “WPA support” is dependant on the wifi driver/card you are using, not on the distro.
  2. Linux isn’t “user friendly”, it is “power/performance friendly”.
  3. If you aren’t planning on installing Linux in a vm, then you will have to partition. All you’ll have to do is remove the linux partition, pop the Windows XP cd in, go to recovery console and type in ‘fixmbr’. You’ll also probably want to merge the now empty space with your Windows partition.
  4. The windows manager/desktop environment is not dependant on the distribution. You can install any wm/de on any distro you want. You can also have multiple wm/des.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose a distro
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

No Ubuntu, Arch, or any KDE?? Wow… um… I’d go with Fedora
